profile.title: Profile
profile.name: Pablo
profile.aboutMe: I am an allround developer. I am a software developer with good knowledge of front-end and back-end techniques. I like structure and order and I also stand for quality. I love to keep up with the latest technologies to keep code powerful, clean, and efficient. I am also a Machine Learning student as I am fascinated by all the new techniques available that provide innovative solutions thanks to the vast amount of data we have access to.

experience.title: Experiences
experience.subtitle: How did I get to where I am today?

list.title: Machine Learning Engineer Nanodegree
list.description: With this nanodegree I've learned the core concepts of Machine learning, including Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement and Deep Learning. During this course I've had the chance to complete several real-world projects to apply what I've learned using scikit-learn, keras, tensorflow and several other machine learning libraries

list.title: PyTorch Scholarship Challenge from Facebook
list.description: During this challenge I had the opportunity to learn Deep Learning foundations as well as learning about and building Fully Connected Neural Nets, CNNs and LSTMs with pytorch. For the final project I built a flower classification model that identifies a flower species given an image.

list.title: Developer
list.description: Full time developer in my spare time. During this time I've specialized in Javascript and front-end frameworks like React, Angular, and Backbone. I've also explored back end technologies like node.js and NoSQL databases like MongoDB, as well as some PHP and SQL. I've also had the opportunity to learn other languages like Java where I've developed simple apps and Python where I've had the chance to build modern AI models like CNNs and LSTMs.

list.title: HND Software Development
list.description: The education was mainly Java-based programming, but I also learned about SQL, PHP, MVC and more. During my time in college I've learned the importance of OOP, web and user experience and design.

list.title: Degree in Commerce
list.description: Graduated with honors. During this time I participated in the Erasmus+ program studying in Düsseldorf for an academic year.

list.title: Lifeguard (part-time)
list.description: Being part of a team of lifeguards the duties include lifeguarding, equipment handling, general housekeeping duties and the safe supervision and use of the facilities.

list.title: Chef (part-time)
list.description: On a busy work environment I worked with a team of chefs to prepare and serve meals. Communication was critical within the team to stay efficient and deliver the food as fast as possible.

list.title: Sales Executive (internship)
list.description: In a small team I helped with the development of the spanish branch of the company. My tasks involved client tracking and sales. In this position I developed my understanding of a startup company as well improving my communication skills.

list.title: Project Manager
list.description: Participant and organizer of the Wanderdust team in the Mongol Rally: the longest charity rally in the world. This project was backed up by 7 sponsors and 1,040€ were raised for the NGO AIPC Pandora and their education grants. Blog: wanderdustproject.com

abilities.title: Abilities
abilities.subtitle: All the skills I've gained in the past years.

projects.subtitle: Some of the many projects I've put all my love and passion into!

projects.description: A simple app to keep track of your expenses.

projects.title: Melanoma Detection
projects.description: A Convolutional Neural Network able to find cases of melanoma

projects.title: Customer Segments
projects.description: Find Customer segments using unsupervised learning techniques
